pages.text: In order to connect an instrument or redstone-enabled block to a Transmitter or configure other settings you must insert a Switchboard.$(br2)The Switchboard stores all configured settings and can then be moved between instruments and blocks to quickly transfer settings between them.

pages.title: Crafting
pages.text: $(br)Once you've crafted a Switchboard open up the Instrument GUI for any instrument and insert the Switchboard into the corresponding slot in the GUI.

pages.title: Properties
pages.text: The Switchboard can store several different properties which are used by different blocks and items within MIMI. Hovering your mouse over a Switchboard in your inventory will allow you to see the current properties set on it.$(br2)To see an overview of the different properties that a Switchboard can store go to the Switchboard Properties section of this guide.

pages.title: Modifying Properties
pages.text: When the Switchboard is inserted into an instrument or redstone-enabled block the GUI for the instrument or block will allow you to modify the properties of the Switchboard.$(br2)Any changes that you make will be saved to the Switchboard and when it is removed from the instrument or block it will retain its settings.

pages.title: Modifying Properties
pages.text: Not all blocks and items that accpet a Switchboard use the same set of properties. For example, a Switchboard in the Listener allows you to configure a specific Note to listen for but this property is not used when the Switchboard is inserted into an instrument.$(br2)Incompatible properties will not be erased when the Switchboard is inserted into a new block or item and will simply be ignored.
